item.title: Insecure Deserialization
item.description: Insecure deserialization vulnerabilities happen when applications deserialize program objects without proper precaution. An attacker can then manipulate serialized objects to change the programâ€™s behavior. Mechanisms Serialization is the process by which some bit of data in a programming language gets converted into a format that allows it to be saved in a database or transferred over a network. Deserialization refers to the opposite process, whereby the program reads the serialized object from a file or the network and converts it back into an object.
